```{r prep9}
# prep data for "Table 9. Reproducibility"
names(dat.ts.long)

compare.t9 = dat.ts.long[rep.table==1, ]
dim(compare.t9)
colnames(compare.t9)

compare.t9[,colnames(compare.t9) %in% c("author.year", "far.apart",
                                      "type.measure",
                                      "type.descrip",
                                      "value")]

dt9 = dcast(compare.t9, author.year + far.apart ~ type.descrip + type.measure, 
      value.var="value")

compare.t9$type.measure
compare.t9$type.descrip

class(dt9)
colnames(dt9)

colnames(dt9) = c("Author, year", 
                  "How far apart?",
                  "Count", "Mean",
                  "Count", "Mean",
                  "Count", "Mean",
                  "Count", "Mean"
                  )
colnames(dt9)

```

```{r, results='asis'}

    cgroup=c("",  "Ambulatory", "Clinic", "Home", "Other")
    n.cgroup = c(2,2,2,2,2)
    z=ztable(dt9,
         zebra=2,
         zebra.color = "platinum")
    z=addcgroup(z,
                cgroup=cgroup,
                n.cgroup=n.cgroup)
    
    update_ztable(z, include.rownames=F,
                  caption="<b>Table 9. Reproducibility</b>")
```
